results.title: The Transition tapes
results.brief_description: These tapes are intended to aid the Transition Education evaluation process by raising relevant questions and issues. They enable re-assessment of attitudes to learning and resources, employment and unemployment from five viewpoints : student, teacher, community, employer and school administrator. No other credits available.

results.brief_description: Examines the need for industry and commerce to institute training programs to improve profitability, and discusses the various forms of assistance provided by the National Training Council.

results.title: The Tragic pursuit of perfection
results.creator_credit: Triangle Film Productions and Enrico Fulchinoni
results.brief_description: An experiment in creating a dramatic biography from a painter’s work. The film covers a great deal of Leonardo de Vinci’s activities, explores his sketch books and notebooks, his extraordinary designs for machines of war, his correspondence, his drawings and paintings and his unfinished statuary. “The Tragic pursuit of perfection” is the theme of the film illustrated by the history of “The Last supper”.

results.title: The Traditional world of Islam: the inner life
results.creator_credit: Stephen Cross Ltd, Paul Keeler and Stephen Cross
results.brief_description: Explores the inner life, the mystical path within Islam known as Sufism and the role it has played with the civilization. This film is part of a series which examines various aspects of Islamic civilization. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Traditional world of Islam: nomad and city
results.brief_description: The nomads and the city dwellers - these are the two roles of Islamic civilization, and it is the tension existing between the two which has given to it an inner energy and capacity for self-renewal.

results.title: The Track
results.creator_credit: Chapman Pictures, Hilton Cordell Productions, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Penny Chapman, Nick Greenaway, Michael Cordell and Victoria Pitt
results.brief_description: A 6 part series on the history of the Australian Racing Industry from the different points of view of the jockeys, trainers, bookies, callers, punters and politicians. Horse racing started in the 1700’s to give the developing colony something social and sporting to go to, and was a popular pastime, despite the ban on swearing, fighting, gambling and drinking, and has since developed into a huge industry. Each episode covers a period of time in racing history from 1788 to current racing, and includes interviews with trainers, jockeys and callers of the past. Footage of famous horses includes Phar Lap and Bernborough. Narrated by Tiriel Mora.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chapman Pictures, Hilton Cordell Productions, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Penny Chapman, Nick Greenaway, Michael Cordell and Victoria Pitt

results.title: The Town of no return. The Gravediggers. The Cybernauts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Avengers”.
The Town of no return: Steed and Mrs Peel are sent to the sleepy seaside town of Little Bazeley to investigate the disappearance of four agents. In a town where nobody is what they seem, Peel and Steed disguise themselves as a primary school teacher and property developer and stay at a local hotel called the Gremlin. The highlight of the episode is a leather clad Peel tied down with horse riding apparel. “The Gravediggers”: there’s interference in sector three on the radar, leading to a fear of undetected nuclear weapons. Steed and Mrs Peel head to the town of Prinby, located in the heart of sector three and the burial place of Dr Hubert Marlowe, recently deceased expert in the field. Peel goes undercover as a Nurse at a hospice for railwaymen while Steed visits the benefactor of the establishment. Highlights of the episode include a miniature train ride and Mrs Peel tied to the railway tracks, complete with accompanying music, fitting for a damsel in distress. “The Cybernauts”: three electronics experts are killed by a tall man with brute strength and the number is increasing. They all had an appointment with the Harachi Corporation, an electronics company who have created a new circuit element for transistors. The trail leads Steed and Mrs Peel to United Automation where a wheelchair bound scientist is building an army of radio controlled cybernauts. A highlight of the episode involves Mrs Peel doing karate - in a skirt.

results.title: The Town mouse and the country mouse
results.creator_credit: Kathleen Shannon, ONF | NFB and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: Evelyn Lambert’s well-known style of animation using paper figures and brightly coloured backgrounds, based on an Aesop fable. Tells the simple story of two mice with different lifestyles and suggests that it is far better to live simply and in peace than live in luxury amidst danger
